TopicTitle: >5Mb savefile, Should I worry about this?

Articles.Content: How big savefiles KSP can handle before I should worry about?

Short version, it's fine.

Not sure there's a known upper limit, but obviously a bigger file will take longer to load up. Performance hit will largely depend on your PC.

If you want to shrink it, terminate some old probes that you don't need, and change game options to not allow any persistent debris. If desperate, manually edit it and start deleting completed contracts.

Completed contracts don't take up much at all. It's the craft in flight that occupy like 95% of the file.

Terminate all your unneeded debris and crafts. I bet your LKO is full of boosters.

Yeah if you look into the savefile, its almost all part trees. The description in the savefile of a complex craft can be huge.

In my experience, as my careers progress and more and more craft are in motion at once, the garbage-collection-related "stutter" starts to increase in frequency, thats about the only effect I have seen I think.

Just to pile on here, it's fine.  My own save files routinely get up to 10 MB or thereabouts, in later career when I have a lot of ships flying around.

(The sole exception I've encountered regarding the "don't worry about save file size" rule was when I had a career in which I was using a buggy mod that caused the asteroid-spawning routine to go berserk, and there were literally thousands of asteroids clogging the save file.  I "fixed" it at the time by writing myself a little perl script to go through and scrub them all out of the file, and I'd just run that once a day or so.  Even with all the thousands of asteroids, though, it didn't crash the game or anything; just made it slow to load and slow to pop up the "load save" dialog.)
